frontMatter.title: Multiple responses
frontMatter.description: Follow this pattern to collect multiple responses from users when the same information needs to be gathered repeatedly.
frontMatter.intro: Use this pattern when collecting the same data in a series of questions, such as details about dependents, multiple addresses, or service periods.

when_to_use.value: **Collecting the same data repeatedly.** When gathering the same information across multiple items.
**Unknown quantity of responses.** When the number of items to collect is not predetermined.
**1 to n items.** When forms need repeated similar information across one or more items.

design_principles.value: **Use multi-page approach.** The default approach allows flexible data collection following 'one thing per page'.
**Provide required and optional variants.** Required variant needs at least one item; optional allows skipping entirely.
**Include summary page.** Show all collected items with edit and delete capabilities.
**Use zero-based indexing.** URL structure: /dependents/0/name for first item, /dependents/1/name for second.

when_not_to_use.value: **Single or limited responses.** When collecting single or limited responses, use the Single Response pattern.
**Different questions per item.** When questions differ for each item.

examples.title: Multi-page flow
examples.description: Introduction page, questions flow, and summary page with edit/delete options.

examples.title: Add item variation
examples.description: List of existing items with "Add a new item" action link.

examples.title: Summary cards
examples.description: Cards showing collected information with edit and delete actions.

how_to_build.intro: The multiple responses pattern has several variations to choose from.

steps.value: **Multi-page (recommended):** Introduction page → Questions flow → Summary page.
**Required variant:** At least one item must be added before proceeding.
**Optional variant:** Users may skip the section entirely.
**Add item variant:** Displays existing items as list with 'Add a new item' link. Best when data already exists.
Provide edit and delete capabilities on summary page.

frontMatter.code_usage:
The multiple responses pattern (also known as List & Loop) handles repeated data collection.

**URL Structure:**
```
/<form-root>/<section>/<array-name>/<index>/<question-path>
```

**Examples:**
- First dependent: `/form/dependents/0/name`
- Second dependent: `/form/dependents/1/name`

Use built-in error/validation messages and maintain consistent terminology throughout.

content_considerations.value: Use consistent terminology across pages (e.g., 'dependent' throughout, not 'family member' on some pages).
Include hint text indicating required items or maximum limits.

accessibility.value: Edit links and delete buttons require accessible text so screen reader users understand what is being edited or deleted.
Example: 'Edit John Smith' rather than just 'Edit'.
Ensure summary cards are navigable by keyboard.
Delete confirmation modal must trap focus appropriately.
